IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROMOTE AND FOSTER A PUBLIC APPRECIATION OF THE CINEMATIC ARTS, INCLUDING THE EXHIBITION OF EDUCATIONAL FILMS AND FILMS OF INDEPENDENT AND/OR EMERGING FILMMAKERS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PRESERVE AND OPERATE THE HISTORIC AVON THEATRE BY PROVIDING A CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT FILM, EDUCATIONAL AND PROGRAMMATIC PALETTE, WHICH DRAWS PATRONS FROM THE GREATER STAMFORD REGION.
IRS990.Desc: MANY PEOPLE VIEW THE CINEMA AS A SOURCE OF ENTERTAINMENT, HOWEVER THE AVON IS DRIVEN BY ITS MISSION TO ENHANCE THIS ROLE BY SHOWING FILMS THAT ARE ARTISTICALLY AND/OR SOCIALLY MEANINGFUL AND TO USE THE CINEMA AS A MEANS OF EDUCATING, INSPIRING AND/OR ENGAGING THE GREATER COMMUNITY. THESE GOALS ARE ALWAYS TOP PRIORITY WHEN THE AVON LAYS OUT ITS PROGRAMS, ONLY A PORTION OF WHICH ARE DESCRIBED HERE. AS WE ARE JUST COMING BACK FROM THE PANDEMIC, THIS YEAR WE SAW AGAIN, AS DURING THE PRE-PANDEMIC, SEVERAL PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS WHO COLLABORATED WITH THE AVON TO PRESENT FILMS HIGHLIGHTING MAJOR SOCIETAL ISSUES INCLUDING IMMIGRATION, GUN VIOLENCE, SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND CLIMATE CHANGE. THESE PROGRAMS, WHICH ALL INCLUDED A SPECIAL SCREENING FOLLOWED BY A PANEL DISCUSSION, ATTRACTED WELL OVER 1,000 ATTENDEES. OUR EXHIBITION ON SCREEN SERIES, WHICH PRESENTS FILMS FOCUSING ON THE WORLD'S GREAT ARTISTS AND THEIR WORKS, IS ONLY AVAILABLE IN SELECT THEATERS WITH EACH FEATURE LIMITED TO ONLY TWO SCREENINGS AND CONTINUES TO EDUCATE AND INSPIRE LARGER CROWDS. THE AVON'S COMMITMENT TO EDUCATION CONTINUES TO GROW EACH YEAR. THE AVON CONTINUES TO PROVIDE FREE MEMBERSHIPS TO TEACHERS FROM THROUGHOUT THE REGION WITH THE GOAL OF ENCOURAGING PROFESSIONAL EDUCATORS TO USE QUALITY CINEMA AS A TOOL FOR ENHANCING CLASSROOM LEARNING. APPROXIMATELY 275 EDUCATORS TOOK ADVANTAGE OF THIS OFFERING WITH MANY ENCOURAGING THEIR STUDENTS TO ATTEND SCREENINGS AT THE AVON THAT TOUCHED ON THEIR CURRICULA. THE AVON'S COMPETITIVE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM AWARDED $8,500 THIS YEAR TO 11 HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS WHO SUBMITTED ESSAYS ON WHY FILM MATTERS. THE VARIETY OF FILMS AND THE NUMBER OF THE HIGH SCHOOLS AND TOWNS REPRESENTED GROWS EACH YEAR WHILE THE QUALITY OF THE SUBMISSIONS CONTINUES TO IMPRESS OUR PROFESSIONAL JUDGES. THE AVON IS STRONGLY COMMITTED TO ISSUES OF SOCIAL JUSTICE AND CONTINUES TO BUILD ON ITS PROFESSIONALLY CURATED BLACK LENS SERIES HIGHLIGHTING FILMS MADE BY BLACK FILMMAKERS AND/OR DEALING WITH THE BLACK EXPERIENCE IN AMERICA. THIS YEAR WE PRESENTED THESE FEATURES, ALL WELL RECEIVED AND FOLLOWED BY PRESENTATIONS/DISCUSSIONS WITH THE FILMMAKERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CENTER RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE CENTER HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE. THE CENTER IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR PERIODS PRIOR TO 2020.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE RESULTS OF AN ESSAY CONTEST. PARTICIPANTS SUBMIT ESSAYS ON WHY FILM MATTERS BASED ON A MOVIE RELEASED IN THE PAST YEAR. THE ESSAYS ARE JUDGED BY A PANEL OF BOARD MEMBERS AND OTHER ADVISORS. TO ENSURE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED AS INTENDED, THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ARE SENT DIRECTLY TO THE SCHOOL THAT THE STUDENT WILL BE ATTENDING IN THE FALL.
THE ORGANIZATION IS REPORTING THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS IN COLUMN (B).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHARLES M. ROYCE AND DEBORAH ROYCE HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE ARE NO COMMITTEES WITH THE AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE TO EVERY MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW. THE BOARD SUBMITS ANY QUESTIONS TO THE TREASURER FOR RESOLUTION PRIOR TO FILING. FULL BOARD APPROVAL IS OBTAINED PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS APPLICABLE TO DIRECTORS, OFFICERS AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS. ANNUALLY, EACH DIRECTOR, OFFICER, AND COMMITTEE MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO SIGN OFF ON THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. IF AN INDIVIDUAL BECOMES AWARE OF A POTENTIAL CONFLICT, THEY MUST DISCLOSE ALL FACTS TO THE DIRECTORS CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION. AFTER DISCLOSURE, THE INTERESTED PERSON MUST LEAVE THE ROOM AND THE BOARD MEMBERS WILL VOTE UPON THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE BOARD MINUTES WILL KEEP RECORDS OF THE INDIVIDUAL THAT HAS THE CONFLICT, THE INDIVIDUALS WHO VOTED ON THE CONFLICT, AND ANY ACTION TAKEN AS A RESULT OF THE CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION REVIEW PROCESS FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WAS CONDUCTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND UTILIZED COMPARABLE MARKET DATA OBTAINED FROM AN OUTSIDE CONSULTING FIRM, OPERATIONS INC., SPECIALISTS IN RECRUITING AND HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. OPERATIONS INC. BENCHMARKED THE SALARIES OF SIMILAR POSITIONS IN CONNECTICUT TO HELP THE BOARD TO ARRIVE AT A COMPETITIVE COMPENSATION PACKAGE FOR THE POSITION. THE DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS PERTAINING TO THE REVIEW WERE DOCUMENTED WITHIN THE BOARD MEETING MINUTES. THE LAST COMPENSATION REVIEW PROCESS WAS UNDERTAKEN IN APRIL 2019.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FORM 990, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS A WHOLE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
